p: We detected two previously reported CHIKV amino acid mutations in structural proteins: E2-G60D, which contributes to the increased CHIKV fitness in Ae. albopictus and Ae. aegypti [ 48], and E1-T98A, which may increase the CHIKV infectivity for Ae. albopictus in the presence of E1-A226V substitution [ 49]. Five amino acid mutations, that were previously described to be under positive selection and to delineate the genotype L strains on vector infection, were revealed of MAYV. We also found nsP1-L518A, nsP3-A298P, nsP3-V386T, nsP4-A249K and E1-L300T [ 50].
